result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Lin Dornfeld

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rebecca Adams in court with defendant Amber Lin Dornfeld. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 2 and 3. Sentencing arguments. Court questions Atty Adams as to Green Lake Co. case. DE makes statements. Court orders: 
Court Orders:
Imposed Sentence of 250 days jail; Huber granted as allowed by jail (and for Court appearances as required by Green Lake Co. ); 2 days credit; entitled to good time
- F/F - $1819.00; apply bond, 60 DTP balance
- $139 blood draw fee paid to Village of Hammond
- DNA Sample
- AODA 
-Driver Safety Plan
-30 month revocation
-30 month IID
DE remanded to the Custody of SCC Jail. 
Adjourned at: 3:28 pm
20 days to appeal
Filed by Atty Adams. arc
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

AMENDED
BOND ON FILE

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

8:29 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rebecca Adams in court for Amber Lin Dornfeld. Defendant Amber Lin Dornfeld in court. Atty. Adams requests bond modification, DE intends to move to Green Lake. ADA Becker does not object to SCRAM. Shelby H. from JSC states that DE has not missed a test or had a positive test since testing began, notes testing would typically be eliminated due to compliance. Court modifies bond. Adjourned: 8:35 AM. kma
Bail/bond hearing on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
on Bail Modification. Filed by Atty. Adams. kma

Attorney Rebecca Adams in court for Amber Lin Dornfeld. An amended complaint is filed adding ct 3 - PAC. Not guilty plea is entered. Resolution is expected. There is an open case in another county. A plea date is requested in October. Address confirmed and bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:28 PM  CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Rebecca Adams   DF:  Amber Lin Dornfeld appeared. Atty Adams submits waiver of PH. Court advises DE of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Becker states that Information will mirror the complaint. Atty Adams and DE would like to proceed with ARGN. Court allows an additional 10 days for any substution of judge due to instant ARGN. Attys make statements. Court confirms address of DE. Bond contineus. Adjourned: 1:34 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random alcohol testing UA random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
